content: mint chip mittens the idea for these mittens came about from some minty green yarn in my stash the color reminded me of mint chocolate chip ice cream so i paired the minty green yarn with some chocolatey brown yarn and created these mittens inspired by one of my favorite ice cream flavors feel free to make your mittens in your favorite color/flavor these mittens can be worked flat or in the round instructions are given for both this pattern includes three sizes - child size 6 25 total length by 6 circumference adult small 9 total length by 7 5 circumference and adult large 10 5 total length by 9 circumference both left and right mitten are worked the same supplies needed size 3 75mm/us 5 needles or size required for gauge ◦ 16 sts x 20 row in stockinette stitch = 3 square worsted weight yarn ◦ child size 32g/72yds mc 11g/25yds cc ◦ adult small 50g/115yds mc 16g/36yds cc ◦ adult large 60g/135yds mc 20g/45yds cc stitch markers tapestry needle abbreviations st/sts stitch/stitches pm place marker k knit sm slip marker p purl m1l make one left mc main color m1r make one right cc contrasting color k2tog knit two together rs right side p2tog purl two together ws wrong side cuff important notes when working the corrugated ribbing keep the yarns to the wrong side of the work in the round flat using cc cast on 32 40 48 sts and join in the round being using cc cast on 34 42 50 sts careful not to twist row 1 ws knit all sts using cc round 1 purl all sts using cc row 2 rs *k1 mc p1 cc* repeat until 2 sts remaining k2 round 2 *k1 mc p1 cc* repeat until the end of the round mc row 3 p2 mc *k1 cc p1 mc* repeat round 2 until cuff measures 1 75 2 5 3 repeat row 2 and 3 until cuff measures 1 75 2 5 3 ending with a ws row for both in the round and flat after finishing the corrugated ribbing work two rounds/row in stockinette stitch using mc thumb gusset thumb gusset stitches are worked in mc only increases are made every other round/row follow the chart for the pattern on the rest of the hand in the round flat round 1 pm at beginning of round m1l using mc pm row 1 rs k1 m1l pm follow chart until 1 stitch follow chart until the end of the round remaining k1 mc note all stitches worked between the markers will be in mc row 2 ws p1 mc follow chart until marker sm p to end catch cc floats as needed of row round 2 sm k1 sm follow chart until the end of the round row 3 k1 m1r k to marker m1l sm follow chart until 1 round 3 sm m1r k to 2nd marker m1l sm follow chart stitch remaining k1 mc until
